results.title: Postnatal care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Education for Childbirth”.
Shows the mother in her hospital room, doing exercises, caring for her baby, nursing etc. It discusses the father’s relation to the new situation and portrays some of the joy to be found in the new family constellation. Diagrams show how the mother’s body returns to normal.

results.title: Postman Pat and his black and white cat
results.brief_description: Two episodes of “Postman Pat” Greendale’s favourite postman who loves to deliver the mail with Jess his black and white cat. The first adventure sees Pat, haven broken his own glasses, borrow an old pair of Mrs Goggins. The glasses not being suited to Postman Pat are the cause of a slight muddle as the letters are being delivered to the wrong addresses because Pat can’t read them properly. Pat makes a clay model of his cat Jess, in the second story. He enters it into the Greendale art show where the statue wins a special prize.

results.title: Postman Pat's ABC
results.brief_description: Learn the ABC with Postman Pat. This story takes place in the little village of Greendale. Pat and his trusty companion Jess, the black and white cat, help young Tom Pottage to remember his alphabet. This delightful animation by Ivor Wood is an excellent aid for young children learning the alphabet.

results.creator_credit: Australia. Army. Public Relations Film Unit
results.brief_description: A survey of the rocket research and testing being carried out at Woomera Rocket Range, South Australia. Housing, recreational activities and other amenities are also shown.

results.title: Posters
results.brief_description: Posters are made for people on the move. This video helps you to design eye catching and effective posters. make your own poster work for you with the technique of colour, letter spacing and design.

results.title: Poster
results.creator_credit: Bailey Film Productions and Durrell R. Crays
results.brief_description: A poster sells a product or an idea. It has a single concept; it must be an instant visual communication to impress and motivate the viewer to act on the message. The greatest change in posters is movement - commercials on television are posters in motion. Shows numerous examples of traditional and modern posters.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bailey Film Productions and Durrell R. Crays

results.title: Postcard from Tunis
results.brief_description: The central theme of ‘Postcard from Tunis’ is writing itself - its histories, its inscriptions and its relevance to the human-computer interface. This is explored in a personal, audiovisual portrait of Tunis, the home of my family-in-law. I designed and programmed the unique interface so that it echoes an actual visit, where you can’t help learning a few Tunisian words and with time, starting to read written Arabic. Although the work was designed for adults, children have shown a strong affinity with it.

results.title: Postcard from Perth
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson, Australian National Film Board and Shan Benson
results.brief_description: Perth, far removed from the main centres of Austraian life and industry, is a quiet and peaceful city [1954]. Folks relax and do not seem to hurry. This film reflects somewhat, the leisure and and activities of the people of Perth in the 1950s.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Thompson, Australian National Film Board and Shan Benson

results.title: Post script to empire
results.brief_description: Tells the story of two places, the Isle of Dogs region of London and the recently-built town of Stevenage 30 miles away, the old and the new. Shows Britain trying to come to terms with a world far different from that which it knew before World War II.

results.title: Post partum depression
results.brief_description: Two couples discuss their experience with, and feelings about, post natal depressions and the way they were able to overcome the problem with the aid of a post partum counselling group.
